landmark-no-duplicate-banner:
To ensure a document has at most one banner landmark, you should use the HTML5 `
` element or `role="banner"` attribute on a single container element that holds the website's header content. The banner landmark is meant for the main site header, which typically includes the site logo, main navigation, and possibly a search bar. Here's an example of how to create a single banner landmark using the `
` element: ```html Example Website

Example Website

  • Home
  • About
  • Contact

Welcome to our website

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Integer nec odio. Praesent libero. Sed cursus ante dapibus diam. Sed nisi. Nulla quis sem at nibh elementum imperdiet.

© 2022 Example Website. All rights reserved.

``` In this example, the `
` element is used to create the banner landmark, which contains the site title, navigation, and search form. This ensures that there is only one banner landmark on the page.
